result.markdown:
---
title: "Blog Migrations"
author: "Alex Chisholm"
date: "2024-05-04"
categories: [Website, Python, R]
---


We've migrated to [Quarto](https://quarto.org/).

![](thumbnail.jpg)

Well, actually we left the old blog in the same spot and just started fresh over here.

Quarto makes it easy for us to discuss **Python**....


::: {.cell python.reticulate='false'}

```{.python .cell-code}

import pandas as pd 

data = {
    'Name': ['Sara', 'Malik', 'Lina', 'Ahmed', 'Maya'],
    'Age': [25, 30, 35, 40, 45],
    'City': ['New York', 'Los Angeles', 'Chicago', 'Houston', 'Boston']
}

df = pd.DataFrame(data)
print(df)

```


::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
    Name  Age         City
0   Sara   25     New York
1  Malik   30  Los Angeles
2   Lina   35      Chicago
3  Ahmed   40      Houston
4   Maya   45       Boston
```


:::
:::


And **R**...


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)

data <- tibble(
  Name = c("Sara", "Malik", "Lina", "Ahmed", "Maya"),
  Age = c(25, 30, 35, 40, 45),
  City = c("New York", "Los Angeles", "Chicago", "Houston", "Boston")
)

data
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 5 Ã— 3
  Name    Age City       
  <chr> <dbl> <chr>      
1 Sara     25 New York   
2 Malik    30 Los Angeles
3 Lina     35 Chicago    
4 Ahmed    40 Houston    
5 Maya     45 Boston     
```


:::
:::


**All in the same place!**
